Section 1:
Child Development

Why Do Child Care Providers Administer Medications?

The first topic we will cover in this training is child development.

Although our focus will be on ages birth to five, we will also discuss the development of children up to 12 years old.

  • Treatment of Short-Term Illnesses

    Children may be on medications for a short-term illness.

  • Management of Chronic Health Conditions

    Children with chronic health conditions may require ongoing medications while in your care to ensure management of their conditions.

  • Compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act

    The law under the Americans with Disabilities Act requires all child care, schools, and Head Start Programs to administer most prescribed medications to children with chronic medical conditions and special health care needs.
